function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Deployment of IoT devices for data-driven services may increase the risk of contagion spread due to physical interaction with devices.","Impact":"Potential escalation of contagious diseases and increased public health risk due to physical contact with infected devices.","Mitigation":"Regular sanitization protocols for IoT devices and minimizing physical interaction through touchless interfaces.","Technologies":"Touchless interfaces, self-sanitizing surfaces for IoT devices.","People":"Citizens, public health officials, and anyone coming in contact with IoT devices in smart cities.","Owner":"City governments, private organizations, and technology providers."},{"Description":"Reliance on automated systems for targeted pandemic response may lead to errors in identifying and controlling contagious diseases.","Impact":"Inaccurate detection of pandemics, leading to delayed response and potential public health crises.","Mitigation":"Implementing robust validation and verification processes for automated response systems, along with human oversight and intervention.","Technologies":"Machine learning algorithms for pandemic detection, human-in-the-loop systems for validation.","People":"Citizens relying on automated pandemic response systems, public health officials overseeing the technology.","Owner":"City governments, technology providers, public health agencies."},{"Description":"Vulnerability of data-driven services and IoT devices to cyber-attacks may compromise pandemic firmware updates for IoT devices.","People":"Citizens relying on data-driven pandemic response, public health officials overseeing the technology.","Owner":"City governments, technology providers, cybersecurity experts."}]}
